channel.title: Exception in thread error. Help would be appreciated :)
channel.description:
Hey i know this has been asked a lot but ive searched and every post that ive seen about this has had no answer.
It would be greatly appreciated if someone could please help me solve this problem. Here is what came up in the command box when i tried to run a server client.
"Welcome to Galkons Pride Client! Made by Galkon Credits to IceMan, RuneServer Members, and Gliomaru Join forums http://galkonspride.ipbfree.com Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . ."
Thanks in advance :)

item.title: Exception in thread error. Help would be appreciated :)
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Eh, your environment variables are not right. (I had the same problem a while back but I sat down and started to really think on it and fixed it!)

Read full topic
item.source: Exception in thread error. Help would be appreciated :)

ahh, i’m having the same problem.
i downloaded the newest version of java tho and its still giving me the same error as before.
what do i do?!

item.title: Exception in thread error. Help would be appreciated :)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“def leppard, post:3, topic:186990”]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
ok bad bad bad… that means you dont have the best java you can get go get a new 1 its mostly works
http://java.sun.com[/quote]
… dot dot dot dot dot dot fucking dot.

Read full topic

item.title: Exception in thread error. Help would be appreciated :)
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

There’s no class called EGUI which is trying to be accessed.

Read full topic

@Redxlll wrote:

Hey i know this has been asked a lot but ive searched and every post that ive seen about this has had no answer.

It would be greatly appreciated if someone could please help me solve this problem. Here is what came up in the command box when i tried to run a server client.

“Welcome to Galkons Pride Client!
Made by Galkon
Credits to IceMan, RuneServer Members, and Gliomaru
